page.title: 04Farming S.E. of Guildford
page.content:
Most of the farms are situated at the foot of the chalk Downs. Most farms raise either beef cattle or dairy cattle. South Warren Farm, White Lane Farm, Burwood Farm and Manor Farm all raise beef cattle. Tyting Farm and Hornhatch Farm raise dairy cattle. Tyting Farm delivers milk and Channel Island cream around the Guildford area.
Many of the farms also grow crops which are mostly used as fodder, but Warren Farm grows cereal crops. Burwood Farm also rears thoroughbred horses and they have a number of mares and foals. Great Halfpenny Farm is unique in this area because it keeps sheep on ten acres of land. Most of the farmers employ a few farm hands to help with the general working of the farms.
